summary: To be employed as an Administrative Assistant or similar role where my interpersonal communication, time management, problem resolution, and organizational skills will benefit the company. Experienced Office Manager with a strength in managing multiple projects simultaneously and fostering a cohesive staff. Proficient in MS Office Suite with experience creating Excel databases and PowerPoint presentations.

experience.title: History Teacher
experience.description: Instructed middle school students through lectures, discussions, group activities and demonstrations. Prepared daily lesson plans for activities. Planned and supervised class projects, field trips and visits by guest speakers. Established positive rapport with students and parents through home calls, agenda book notes, email correspondence, and newsletters. Integrated technology into the classroom as an instructional tool. Communicated objectives for all lessons, units and projects to students and their parents. Administered and graded tests and assignments to evaluate students' progress. Identified signs of emotional or developmental problems in students.

experience.title: Principal
experience.description: Led school operations; instructed up to a number of students individually and in groups; set up lesson materials, bulletin board displays and demonstrations; promoted development by implementing classroom games and outdoor recreational activities. Adapted teaching methods and materials to meet students' varying needs and interests. Met regularly with parents and guardians to discuss children's progress. Observed and evaluated students' performance, behavior, social development and physical health. Encouraged interactive learning by incorporating educational software and the Internet. Supervised students in classrooms, halls, cafeterias, schoolyards and on field trips. Planned and implemented creative lessons, prepared necessary paperwork, and maintained records. Created an engaging learning environment; collaborated with other teachers and administrators; pursued professional development; maintained confidentiality of student records; participated in professional organizations; created and taught math lessons; fostered oral language development and critical thinking.

experience.title: Second Grade Teacher
experience.description: Instructed up to a number of students individually and in groups. Set up lesson materials, bulletin board displays and demonstrations. Promoted physical, mental and social development by implementing classroom games and outdoor recreational activities. Adapted teaching methods and materials to meet students' varying needs and interests. Met regularly with parents and guardians to discuss children's progress. Observed and evaluated students' performance, behavior, social development and physical health. Encouraged interactive learning by incorporating educational software and the Internet. Supervised students in classrooms, halls, cafeterias, schoolyards and on field trips. Planned and implemented creative lessons in accordance with district, county, state and federal guidelines. Completed and filed all necessary paperwork for classroom activities, including meal count sheets and attendance logs. Created an enjoyable and interesting learning environment for several students each year. Maintained accurate and complete records for many students. Worked with other teachers and administrators to evaluate and revise elementary school programs. Assessed students' reading levels using DIBELS Next and Leveled Reading Passages. Enforced the school's student discipline code to deal with problem situations. Drafted lesson plans and submitted them for review and feedback in a timely manner. Created and taught engaging math lessons and activities.

experience.title: Administrative Assistant/Sales Representative
experience.description: Human resource responsibilities including interviewing, onboarding (gathering employment information, submitting background checks, in-house drug screening, I-9 verification, employment and education verification, and testing required skills) hiring, terminating employees, and submitting information for workman's compensation claims. Accounting responsibilities including effectively handling payroll and invoicing issues, submitting bills to be paid, and issuing bill backs to companies. Sales responsibilities including company research, sales calls, preparing business quotes, and meeting with potential clients. Administrative responsibilities including frequent email and letter correspondence with clients and associates, answering phones, scheduling appointments and interviews, recording new orders, and sending invoices to clients. Overview of educator responsibilities; resolved employment-related disputes through proactive communication; organized and led a staff orientation and training to promote collaboration; handled understaffing, disputes, terminating employees and administering disciplinary procedures.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Interdisciplinary Studies (Business, Geology, and Education)

certifications: Texas Property/Casualty and Life/Health Insurance Licenses
Exxon Mobil Site Specific Industrial Safety Training Council
